intro: Anagallis granvikii, commonly known as the granvik's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of delicate, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with moderate to high rainfall. Anagallis granvikii is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
